title: Sri Lanka gets Julian Wood as batting coach
byline: Sri Lanka’s cricket board on Saturday announced expanding its coaching team with the induction of Julian Wood, known for his power-hitting programme, and spin specialist Rene Ferdinands.

title: Sri Lanka v Australia Women’s World Cup game washed out
byline: The league stage match between defending champions Australia and Sri Lanka at the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 was abandoned without a ball bowled at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

title: US navy ship USS Fitzgerald departs Colombo
byline: The USS Fitzgerald (DDG 62) of the United States Navy, which arrived in Colombo for a replenishment visit, departed the island on yesterday.

title: Fuel station to be established on Delft island for the first time
byline: An agreement was reached today with the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) to establish a fuel station on Delft Island for the first time in history, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister and Leader of the House, Bimal Ratnayake said.

title: 84 people affected by adverse weather in five provinces: DMC
byline: A total of 84 people from 49 families have been affected by the prevailing inclement weather in the Central, North Central, Northern, Southern, and North Western Provinces, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported.

title: Netanyahu says he hopes to announce hostage release in the ’coming days’
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said he hopes to announce the release of hostages being held in Gaza ’’in the coming days’’.

title: Harsha raises concerns on Central Expressway contract
byline: Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (CoPF) Harsha De Silva raised concerns on the new contract for the construction of the Central Expressway, claiming that negotiations with neither the contractor (MCC) on their claims nor with China EXIM Bank on terms and conditions on the reduced USD 500 million facility have been completed.

title: $1 Trump coin draft is ‘real,’ US Treasurer says
byline: A portrait of President Donald Trump may be featured on a commemorative $1 coin issued by the United States Mint in honor of America’s 250th birthday in 2026, according to first drafts of the images confirmed by the US Treasury.

title: Fisherman nabbed for smuggling Rs. 4.5 million worth of cigarettes at BIA
byline: A 44-year-old fisherman from Kalpitiya, Puttalam, was arrested this morning (5) for attempting to smuggle foreign-made cigarettes worth Rs. 4.5 million into Sri Lanka.

title: Government committed to equal service for all citizens: Minister
byline: Past governments, whether from the North or based in Colombo, had failed to provide equal services to all citizens, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister and Leader of the House of Parliament, Bimal Ratnayake, said.

title: Three killed in accident in  Narammala
byline: Three people have died in a tragic road accident that occurred early this morning (05) near Narammala town on the Narammala–Kurunegala road, when a lorry collided head-on with a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus.
